lead_paragraph: The presumptive Democratic nominee’s campaign said she plans to eliminate tuition at in-state public colleges for families with annual incomes under $125,000.

byline.contributor: Patrick Healy and Alan Rappeport contributed reporting.
byline.original: By STEPHANIE SAUL and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

headline.print_headline: Clinton Adopts  a Sanders Idea in Tuition Plan
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Embraces Ideas From Bernie Sanders’s College Tuition Plan

snippet: The presumptive Democratic nominee’s campaign said she plans to eliminate tuition at in-state public colleges for families with annual incomes under $125,000....
abstract: Hillary Clinton's campaign announces proposal to eliminate tuition at in-state public colleges and universities, embracing key component of Sen Bernie Sanders's presidential campaign platform; move aims to draw in supporters of Sanders and unite Democratic party behind Clinton.
